docs.text: underwater science fiction stays submerged
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sphere a film review by michael redman copyright 1998 by michael redman
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one of the most unpleasant experiences that can occur in a movie theater is when a cast of fine actors end up in a film that wastes their talents .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you keep thinking what they might have accomplished with the time they squandered .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: psychologist norman goodman ( dustin hoffman ) is called to the middle of the pacific ocean to work with the survivors of a plane crash .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when he arrives at the site , he discovers that there is no plane , but rather an enormous spacecraft that has been sitting 1 , 000 feet below the surface for almost 300 years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: having written a paper for the bush administration on how to handle first contact , he is chosen to head up the team of scientists investigating the ship .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his group as outlined in his report , consists of beth halperin ( sharon stone ) , a biochemist ; harry adams ( samuel l . jackson ) , a mathematician ; and ted fielding ( liev schreiber ) , an astrophysicist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately it turns out that the writing was a blow-off project for goodman who did it for the money and named his then-colleagues to the team .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " after all , " he explains , " who reads government documents ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lead by harold barnes ( peter coyote ) , a top secret federal operative , the group descends to a mobile undersea headquarters set up next to the alien vessel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: once there they stroll over , knock on the door and explore the still-operational ufo .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: discovering the surprising origin of the ship and the crew finds an astonishing gigantic golden liquid metal sphere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when adams enters the sphere , the weirdness unfolds .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a storm rolls in on the surface and the team is forced to remain below just as an unseen presence begins to communicate through their computer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " my name is jerry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i am happy " flashes across the screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is unsettling for the psychologist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " what happens if jerry gets mad ? " he asks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: barnes is more pragmatic : he needs a last name because he can't put in his report that they made contact with an alien named jerry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then the situation turns bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: deadly beasts appear from nowhere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a gang of jellyfish kills one of the navy personnel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lethal sea snakes attack goodman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a giant squid batters the habitat just as adams is reading " 20 , 000 leagues under the sea " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the suspicious scientists turn against each other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this has all the makings of a first-rate thinking man's science fiction film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however even the finest ingredients don't go very far in the hands of a chief who doesn't seem to care about his product .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director barry levinson has churned out a mish-mosh that doesn't engage the audience beyond a few skillful suspense scenes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the first of the film zooms by as the situation and players are introduced without any characterization or justification .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's much like speed-reading a novel and realizing that you missed the nuances .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it doesn't get any better when the action scenes begin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while the actors do an adequate job with their limited roles , the people are still flat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oddly they hardly have reactions when deaths occur around them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after adams experiences the interior of the sphere , no one bothers to ask him what happened .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their history together is an intriguing plot device but is barely exploited .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even goodman and halperin's ill-conceived affair when she was his student is just mentioned in passing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: her psychotic tendencies are talked about but never convincing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a truism that items shown early in a movie must be used before the ending , but here they are far too obvious .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when an emergency mini-sub is explained , you know what's going to happen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie affectations are nothing more than distracting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chapter headings that divide the movie have no function .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the shaky camera work muddies already perplexing chaos .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: much of what goes on is confusing and difficult to follow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although some of the disorientation eventually is understandable , a great deal of it isn't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even a science fiction film must be internally consistent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's too much here that doesn't make sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: are the manifestations real ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the jellyfish kill queen latifa ( in a throw-away role ) and the squid nearly destroys the outpost , but the bites of the fatal snakes have no effect .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a scene in the sub suggests that it's illusion , but earlier episodes indicate that it's not .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not everything has to be explained to death , but there are major questions that the film never answers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where the ship came from is clarified , but how it ended up on the ocean floor in 1709 is merely alluded to .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even the enigmatic sphere is still mysterious when the credits roll .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the climax is followed by 15 minutes of epilogue that does little but weaken the already labored tale .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after pre-release audience testing , the actors were called back to re-shoot the ending .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's difficult to imagine how the original could have been worse .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: following the recent tradition of lengthy films , this weighs in at over two very long hours .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the weak scenes could have been cut , but then there wouldn't have been much left .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie was supposedly held up by effects work , but there's nothing special on the screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we never even see the monstrous squid or the menacing storm .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: stealing from " alien " , " the abyss " and the disastrous " event horizon " , this film has learned nothing from them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: remarkably levinson and hoffman's other currently showing film is " wag the dog " , a smart and entertaining piece of work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this one could have been titled the same sans one word .
docs.label: negative
